title: The Blue Marble
summary: The Blue Marble is an image of Earth taken on December 7, 1972, by the Apollo 17 crew  Harrison Schmitt and Ron Evans from a distance of about 29,000 kilometers (18,000 miles) from the planet's surface.[1][2][3] It was taken by the crew of the Apollo 17 spacecraft on its way to the Moon, and is one of the most reproduced images in history.[4][5][lower-alpha 1]
